name: HD 22781
scenarioDescription:
The HD 22781 Exoplanetary System

HD 22781 is a star with 0.75 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8450000000000001 times its radius. It is located 106.42 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 22781 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

HD 22781 b

HD 22781 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2012-02. Its semi-major axis is 1.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 528.07 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, HD 22781.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.8191, which means that when HD 22781 b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.21 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 2.12. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of HD 22781 b is 4338.11 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 22781 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 22781, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Haute-Provence Observatory.
